Sorry, I just read Jim's discussion, but I think the plant used for the
Tokugawa mon and that on this bowl is the tachi-aoe or hollyhock. Also, the
vines and what not, are not tachi-aoe elements, but closer to karakusa or
arabesques/foliage and are often found in lacquered pieces. I have a
naginata pole with the same arabesques and mon (different mon). 

 

Gordon

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Gordon Robson [mailto:robsongo@...] 
Sent: Saturday, January 08, 2005 8:28 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Paulownia ?????

 

This entire motif is Aoe either as a mon or as a plant.



Gordon



-----Original Message-----
From: RCorbin [mailto:nihonto@...] 
Sent: Friday, January 07, 2005 10:30 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Paulownia ?????



It may also be part of the Aoi  plant (futuba-aoi), mallow or birthwort
family (uma no suzukusa) or "Wild Ginger". Presented on the lacquer ware in
arabesque pattern/motif. 

Rick  

-------Original Message------- 

From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
Date: 01/05/05 21:36:42 
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: [nihontostudy] Paulownia ????? 

all, is the smaller of the flower/leaves ( on the vine ) on this design 
Paulownia ?. I know the the larger leaves are Aoi, as in the mon but it 
is the smaller ones I am trying to place. 

Cheers 

Rich
